title: Opposition unity on display in Tamil Nadu anti-Mekedatu protests
title_page: Opposition unity on display in Tamil Nadu anti-Mekedatu protests - The Economic Times
text: CHENNAI: Opposition parties in Tamil Nadu on Tuesday staged a protest against Karnataka’s plan to build a reservoir on the Cauvery River, in a demonstration of unity among political outfits expected to coalesce as alliance partners ahead of the parliamentary polls in 2019.Doubts over the cohesiveness in the multi-party alliance had emerged after DMK treasurer and senior leader Durai Murugan recently qualified parties such as MDMK and Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi as “friendly parties”, and said the question of whether they would become alliance partners could be addressed only ahead of the elections.MDMK chief Vaiko, in response to Murugan’s statement, had said DMK president MK Stalin needed to clarify on the status of eight parties such as the MDMK in terms of their ties with the DMK electorally.In the context of uncertainty over the constituents of the DMK-Congress alliance, the coming together of all Opposition parties now serves a “necessary symbol” for the forthcoming election season, said Congress spokesperson Americai Narayanan.But N Sathiya Moorthy, a political analyst and the Chennai Chapter head of think tank The Observer’s Foundation, called it “a tenuous relationship”. Small parties are making a beeline for the DMK-Congress alliance after having lost in the previous parliamentary polls contesting without any Dravidian party in alliance, he said.The Mekedatu reservoir plan arrives at a time when slow relief efforts in the aftermath of the Gaja cyclone have turned into a tool for the Opposition to take on the ruling AIADMK in the state.A controversy since 2013, the Mekedatu reservoir issue flared up again after a recent Central Water Commission approval to Karnataka’s feasibility report, and permission to draft a detailed project report.The Tamil Nadu government has moved the Supreme Court seeking withdrawal of the permission and directions to Karnataka to maintain status quo on the project.Even as the AIADMK sends out statements to reassure Cauvery Delta farmers in the aftermath of the Gaja cyclone, the DMK organised a protest in Trichy to condemn the Centre for granting the permission.The DMK’s unveiling of a statue of late leader M Karunanidhi on December 16 is considered as another platform for Opposition unity. With Congress leader Sonia Gandhi expected to attend the ceremony, the event is likely to fortify the existing DMK-Congress coalition and expand the alliance’s base to other parties.“We have invited only state chief ministers, and, of course, Sonia Gandhi,” said a DMK leader on the conditions of anonymity.Besides the general elections, Tamil Nadu is also slated for by-polls in 18 constituencies that became vacant after lawmakers with TTV Dhinakaran lost their legal battle against the speaker’s decision to disqualify them for “voluntarily giving up their membership” of the AIADMK.The Election Commission had sought details of legal encumbrances to holding by-polls.The state elections department had responded that there have been no appeals challenging the recent Madras High Court order upholding the disqualification of the MLAs, said an official with the department.
